Package game.general

Class DragonTreasure

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.general.DragonTreasure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    K
    public class DragonTreasure
extends Object
implements K
    Sets up the game by creating rooms with different attributes such as doors, items etc.; asks the user of their current environment (IDE or UNIX terminal / Windows CMD) and prompts the user for a player name. Initiates a Dungeon-instance which starts the game. Handles the ending of the game as well.

      A scanner which is used mainly in this project to take user input.
      private VisualEffectManager visualEffectManager
      Represents a manager which takes care of visual effects (Clearing the console in particular)

      • DragonTreasure

    • Method Detail

      • setupGame

        public void setupGame()
               throws Exception
        Sets up the game. Creates all the rooms and initializes them with their doors and other specified attributes (such as items, monsters etc.); connects the rooms with each other; creates a player with the user provided name; starts a new game after the setup and ends the game after the game is over.
        Throws:
        Exception - If Door-instances are initiated with an invalid position as an argument, if something goes wrong while the console is being cleared or if the amount of doors in a room exceeds the maximal amount.

      • endGame

        public void endGame​(Dungeon dungeon,
                    Player player)
        Prints out the result of the game: A win- or lose-message with corresponding ASCII-art and the player stats.
        Parameters:
        dungeon - The dungeon to be referred to for determining the game result (win/lose).
        player - The player which the statistics will refer to.

      • startPrompt

        private String startPrompt()
                    throws Exception
        Prompts the user for a player name and provides them with an option to quit the program.
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the player inputted by the user, or null. Trims the beginning and the end of the returned string from spaces and replaces multiple spaces with just one from anywhere besides the beginning or the end of the string. Returns null if user decides to exit the program by providing the exit-command as input.
        Throws:
        Exception - If something goes wrong with clearing the console.

      • environmentCheckPrompt

        private boolean environmentCheckPrompt()
                                throws Exception
        Asks the user if they are running the program from an IDE or from a UNIX terminal or Windows CMD. This is done to determine if console clearing should be turned on or off, since console clearing doesn't necessarily work when the program is run from an IDE.
        Returns:
        Returns false if the user chooses to exit the game. Returns true otherwise if the user chooses one of the two first provided alternatives.
        Throws:
        Exception - If something goes wrong with clearing the console.

      • assignDescriptions

        private void assignDescriptions​(String[] roomDescArr)
        Assigns descriptions to the list of rooms.
        Parameters:
        roomDescArr - Descriptions assigned to the list of rooms.
